channel.title: Updating!
channel.description: is there any way to update without a batch file! come on rolling on java, silabsoft and others, help me put my server back up! is there ANY WAY?[br][size=1]Posted on: March 04, 2007, 04:59:31 AM[/size][hr]theres a spot for co-owner of my server if you can help a lot![br][size=1]Posted on: March 04, 2007, 05:02:41 AM[/size][hr]please, i really need help i will be eternally grateful :( i've tried to fix my server for 3 weeks now, a miracle happens in the 2nd week and it worked, but only for that day, and i didn't do anything special that day just opened up my computer and tried helplessly to open up my server[br][size=1]Posted on: March 04, 2007, 05:05:08 AM[/size][hr]god blessed me that day now he's cursing me again *grumbles loudly* i hate torture whenever i try to run a batch file it sends me a message saying "another program is currently using this file in the week before that, i installes starcraft, maplestory, bots and microsoft framework 3.0 help me please, all the major coders out there!

item.title: Updating!
item.dc:creator: @Waterslasher Waterslasher
item.description:
@Waterslasher wrote:

but i still don’t know what’s wrong with my batch files…
i don’t want to use this every time i want to update
besides, i got errors[br][size=1]Posted on: March 05, 2007, 04:49:44 AM[/size][hr]i opened cmd.exe
i pasted in

“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_07\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
“C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.5.0_11\bin\java.exe” server
pause

it came up with

Microsoft Windows XP [Version 5.1.2600]
© Copyright 1985-2001 Microsoft Corp.

C:\DOCUME~1\A\LOCALS~1\Temp\Rar$EX47.448>“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_07\bin
javac.exe” -cp . *.java
error: cannot read: *.java
1 error

C:\DOCUME~1\A\LOCALS~1\Temp\Rar$EX47.448>“C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.5.0_11\bin
java.exe” server
Exception in thread “main” java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: server

C:\DOCUME~1\A\LOCALS~1\Temp\Rar$EX47.448>pause[br][size=1]Posted on: March 05, 2007, 04:51:34 AM[/size][hr]please help, i feel i’m so close to fixing this monstrousity…
gulp[br][size=1]Posted on: March 05, 2007, 04:54:53 AM[/size][hr]wow! nvm i figured it out!
yippeee!!!
yay!!!
W00t W00t
shame i can’t rep you, it says i don’t have enough reputation[br][size=1]Posted on: March 05, 2007, 05:03:22 AM[/size][hr]someone should lock and sticky this on the forum, it’ll help other poor lost souls like me :D[br][size=1]Posted on: March 05, 2007, 05:06:17 AM[/size][hr]this sucks, i really wanna rep you for all your help
i’ve tried to fix this for soooooo long, and you fixed it in a flash!
TY!!!

Read full topic

item.title: Updating!
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

That is the command processor. You use it to tell the computer to do shit. That is the program running the .bat files. Learn to use it properly.

Read full topic

and why should i get rid of Norton AntiVirus?[br][size=1]Posted on: March 05, 2007, 04:28:45 AM[/size][hr]i’m trying to upload 3 images at once onto imageshack, and it’s taking AGES[br][size=1]Posted on: March 05, 2007, 04:33:13 AM[/size][hr][br][size=1]Posted on: March 05, 2007, 04:33:50 AM[/size][hr][br][size=1]Posted on: March 05, 2007, 04:34:32 AM[/size][hr]i’ve yet to include the middle, uploading it right now[br][size=1]Posted on: March 05, 2007, 04:36:25 AM[/size][hr]here it is

@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

C:\WINDOWS\system32\taskmgr.exe is the taskmanager thing you know. Microsoft sticks tons of debuggers and shit in that folder. Also most of the OS …

item.title: Updating!
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

A batch file is just a prewritten script for cmd.exe. Try to learn what your using before you make a topic over woes at being unable to use it. Type the same thing that is in your batch file into the command interpreter and it will give you line for line the same responses. As for your ‘updating’ business, well, learn C:

void v(){
   /* Do stuff */
}

void *f = &v;
f();
f = &someothervoid;
f();

Read full topic
